alert.note: Alert for Dyer; Gibson; Obion (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Memphis (Western Tennessee, Eastern Arkansas and Northern Mississippi)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 27 at 6:05AM CDT until March 29 at 5:00PM CDT by NWS Memphis
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Tennessee... Obion River near Obion For the Obion River...including Martin, Obion, Bogota...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM THIS MORNING TO WEDNESDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Obion River near Obion. * WHEN...From this morning to Wednesday afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 35.0 feet, Several secondary roads and large areas of farmland are flooded in northern Dyer County. Flooding is occurring around Rives in southeast Obion County. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 5:00 AM CDT Monday the stage was 34.4 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 5:00 AM CDT Monday was 34.4 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 35.1 feet just after midnight tonight. It will then fall below flood stage late Wednesday morning. - Flood stage is 34.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at weather.gov/memphis. The next statement will be issued as conditions warrant.
